channel.title: attack.t1071.004 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1071.004 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: DNSCat2 Powershell Implementation Detection Via Process Creation
item.description: The PowerShell implementation of DNSCat2 calls nslookup to craft queries. Counting nslookup processes spawned by PowerShell will show hundreds or thousands of instances if PS DNSCat2 is active locally.

item.title: High DNS Requests Rate
item.description: High DNS requests amount from host per short period of time

item.title: High NULL Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of NULL record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of iodine tool execution

item.title: High TXT Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of TXT record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of Do-exfiltration tool execution

item.title: Possible DNS Tunneling
item.description: Normally, DNS logs contain a limited amount of different dns queries for a single domain. This rule detects a high amount of queries for a single domain, which can be an indicator that DNS is used to transfer data.

item.title: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

item.title: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: DNS Tunnel Technique from MuddyWater
item.description: Detecting DNS tunnel activity for Muddywater actor

item.title: DNS TXT Answer with Possible Execution Strings
item.description: Detects strings used in command execution in DNS TXT Answer
